summary: The 'Leadership in Critical and Emerging Technologies Act' (S. 1833) establishes a pilot program within the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) to expedite the examination of patent applications related to critical and emerging technologies (CET). These technologies include artificial intelligence, semiconductor design, and quantum information science. The program aims to encourage innovation and US leadership in these fields by providing faster patent review.  The bill also outlines eligibility criteria, program termination conditions, renewal possibilities, and reporting requirements to Congress.
